data.title: MovieClip issue with sound - Round 3 :)
data.body:
I just found another problem with sounds playback in the MovieClip class:

When you add a sound to frame zero and call `play`, it won't be played (except when the clip is looping, beginning with the second loop).

Furthermore, the `currentFrame` setter will always play a sound of that frame, even if the clip has not been started.

data.title: MovieClip issue with sound - Round 2 :)
data.body:
Looks like another possible followup sound fix for MovieClip:
http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/movieclip-bug-1

case where play() should be play(0, 0, mSoundTransform) ?

data.title: "HOVER" TouchEvent should not be fired on deviced not supporting cursor
data.body:
I had a problem where buttons stayed on there "over" state due to the reception of an "HOVER" TouchEvent just after the release of said buttons.

After a few exchange with Jeff, he came to the conclusion that "Hover" TouchEvent probably shouldn't be fired if Mouse.supportsCursor is false. Here is the reference on the Starling forums : 
http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/touchevent-hover-event-fired-after-ended-event

data.title: GPU memory leak
RangeError: Error #1125 at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()
data.body:
Our users sometimes encounter a starling error, that we cant reproduce. Game is running starling 1.7 RC1

We logged some stats from game:
playerMemory: 130MB fullMemory: 429MB freeMemory: 32MB CPU: 0.00 averageFPS: 36.75 played: 2.65min 
flash version: WIN 17,0,0,188 

Compiled with ascsh v0.4 (flashDevelop, SDK: AIR 16.0.0)

stackTrace:RangeError: Error #1125 at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render() at starling.display::Sprite/render() at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render() at starling.display::Sprite/render() at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render() at starling.display::Sprite/render() at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render() at starling.core::Starling/render() at starling.core::Starling/nextFrame() at starling.core::Starling/onEnterFrame()

Is it something on our end? Or bug in library?

data.title: ProgressEvent on android not work
Crashing during loading using AssetManager
data.body:
I can confirm that the IO Error does happen on mobile I am not sure on why or the circumstance. However we are finding that the onIOError causes a null exception reference error see a logged stack trace below.

TypeError: Error #1009
1   at Function/AssetManager.as$7:anonymous()
2   at starling.utils::SystemUtil$/executeWhenApplicationIsActive()
3   at Function/complete()
4   at Function/onIoError()
5   at flash.events::EventDispatcher/dispatchEvent()
6   at flash.net::URLLoader/onComplete()

Unfortunately we don't get a line number for the anonymous function throwing the error. But as its anonymous its one of the methods you are creating anonymously most probably the error is due to these lines in the Asset Manager. Actually its quite an easy error to follow to prove this!

asset.bitmapData.dispose();

or

asset.clear();

You will see that in the complete method you pass null as the asset in the case of error, but the complete handler will try to access this as seen above causing an exception meaning that an error can't be handled without causing the app to crash.

Read more here http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/assetmanager-failing-to-load-textures?replies=10#post-80965

data.title: Added check in contextValid() method for empty context.driverInfo String
data.body:
Hi!

I've noticed in some exception log files that the Context3D.driverInfo string can be empty, and in this case the context is also invalid. (The Context3D.profile has null value both when the string is empty "''" or 'Disposed'). The problem occurs mostly using Flash Player 16.X.

Just for note: the documentation about the possible values is not really detailed: http://help.adobe.com/en_US/FlashPlatform/reference/actionscript/3/flash/display3D/Context3D.html#driverInfo

Best regards!
Andrew

data.title: Question about Textfield restore
[Request] Get Texture of a Filter
data.body:
When I apply a filter to a DisplayObject a new Texture is created.
Would be nice to have a way to retrieve that texture.
Also would be great to be able to set the resolution parameter of a texture because If you try to apply a filter on a device with insane resolution you could get an error because larger than 2048.

data.title: Strange results when using nested rendering to texture
data.body:
This is probably connected with #711 

I have a custom Sprite (BufferedSprite) which renders all its children to a RenderTexture an then display this texture using an Image instance (similar to what Filters do; it's a base class for other classes which would apply post-processing to such output texture before it's displayed).

If I use just one such Sprite, everything works fine. The problems start, when I put one BufferedSprite into another BufferedSprite.

Here's the demo project showing what's happening: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/23855128/BufferedRenderingTest.zip

data.title: textfield formatting issue
data.body: Hi - Jeff suggested submitting this issue (forum http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/textfield-formatting-issue) The probem starts when I create a starling textfield with isHtmlText set to true, and specify some leading (linespacing) in my text. For example: < textformat leading='10' >contents goes here< /textformat > That works fine and I get a textfield with extra space between lines. But any subsequent starling textfields I create with also have the same leading, even if isHtmlText is to false. I think I can see what's causing it. When you create a new TextFormat object in the starling textfield renderText() method and apply it to the static flash textfield (sNativeTextField), the leading is not specified in the TextFormat constructor. According to the flash textfield documentation, null leading should default to '0', but it isn't. You can replicate this by creating 3 starling textfields, one after the other, side by side, with the same text in each one. Add '< textformat leading='50' >' to the start of the second textfield so that extra linespacing appears between the lines. You should now see that the 3rd textfield has this extra spacing too. I think this could be a flash textfield bug, but can I suggest changing your TextFormat object as a workaround, and explicity setting the leading to '0'? From: var textFormat:TextFormat = new TextFormat(mFontName, mFontSize \* scale, mColor, mBold, mItalic, mUnderline, null, null, hAlign); To: var textFormat:TextFormat = new TextFormat(mFontName, mFontSize \* scale, mColor, mBold, mItalic, mUnderline, null, null, hAlign, null, null, null, 0);

data.title: [Request] Create something like TexturePool
data.body:
When doing custom rendering I often allocate temporary textures just to do some off-screen rendering and dispose them once they are rendered on screen - not the best approach, performance wise. I think Starling could provide something like a TexturePool class (something similar to AssetManager) for allocating temporary textures and returning them back to the pool when they are no longer needed.

I know this sounds like something that an extension could do, but Starling's performance could benefit on this as well. Filters could use this class internally, so many filters which use textures of similar size could use a single Texture instance instead of allocating a new one each. Also RenderTextures which use a second texture internally could all use the same instance when preserving previously rendered contents.

Just an idea, maybe not for the current version, but something to think about for Starling 2.0 :)

data.title: [Request] Make it possible to use RenderTexture with third party code
Error compiling for iOS (armv7 symbol not found)
data.body:
It looks like CharLocation or any other class out of a package are not supported by the architecture.

Solved: Extracting CharLocation to a new file CharLocation.as

data.title: Fix documentation on max quads
data.body: I'm not sure if this should be 16383 or 16382 (16382 would be double the old value), but this updates the comment to match the constant.

data.title: Strange offset applied when rendering an object using FragmentFilter to texture
data.body:
I'm rendering an object with filter attached to a texture. The object itself renders correctly, but the filter below (drop shadow) looks clipped. Also, how it is clipped changes along with pivot change.

Here's the object rendered with pivot at top-left:
![filter_no_align](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/757150/7514318/b1e7c61c-f4bc-11e4-9790-e24fa841fe09.png)

And here's the same object (different background, not important) rendered with pivot centered horizontally and vertically:
![filter_align](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/757150/7514335/cb4bdfe4-f4bc-11e4-846b-e121ce5d0930.png)

As you can see, the shadow is clipped, so my guess is when rendering the first pass the object was not aligned correctly (but the object itself renders onto the texture without any clipping).

data.title: Fixed TravisCI build

Hi,

I've removed the homebrew-binary/adobe-air-sdk dependency from the build script and switched to direct install. This way it can not be broken so easily when the package's version is updated.

Best regards!
Andrew

data.title: Unregistering BitmapFont
data.body:
For my app I must often register/unregister BitmapFont.

Problem occurs when:
1) Register BitmapFont
2) Create TextField and set fontName equals BitmapFont name (internaly TextField set `mIsRenderedText` flag to `true`)
3) Unregister bitmap font
4) Invalidate TextField
5) Catch error "Bitmap font not registered"

If I never register BitmapFont, flag `mIsRenderedText == false`, and TextField succefuly use native text engine.

I understand this is specific and rare problem, but TextField can work without exception if I reassign fontName property after removing BitmapFont, this fact confuse me.

data.title: Feature Request: I need a propertity to get the rendering font size when TextField's autoScale==true.
data.body: Feature Request: I need a propertity to get the rendering font size when TextField's autoScale==true.

data.title: AssetManager disposes / throws errors when enqueueing same asset simoultaneously.
data.body:
The AssetManager has a nifty feature that disposes of an old asset (and its stage presence) if a new asset with the same name is loaded.

A problem arises however if the very same asset gets enqueued at the same time (frequent when loading lists containing duplicate assets). The asset in question gets enqueued more than once and the following happens (line 301, addTexture() in AssetManager.as)

[AssetManager] Warning: name was already in use; the previous texture will be replaced.
Error #2044: Unhandled ErrorEvent:. text=Error #3677: Texture decoding failed. Internal error.

I would advise that the AssetManager iterate through the currently enqueued asset list before actually enqueueing. Additional enqueueing of the same asset would result in only added listeners, which would in turn all receive the onComplete event from the first (and effectively only) enqueueing.
